result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J. Perez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J. Perez was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

15fo1264 Defendant Michael J. Perez in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states agreement.  Atty O'Rourke agrees and NC pleas entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
5 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 2/2/2016 at 6:00 pm
2 days sentence credit to be applied
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Matter may be expunged matter once sentence is completed
Ct 2:  Dismissed

15FO1264 - NC
$263.50 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DE may do AODA
Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth on file.   Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial Br. 2.  Bond continues.

Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth filed and approved.  Attorney ORourke request short reset.  Offer has been made.  Awaiting more information from defendant.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael J. Perez appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.
